other_tests.findings: The patient responded to ECT after failing to respond to psychotherapy and antidepressant medication. Reporting improved mood, increased appetite, and resolution of suicidal ideation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Improvement continued and was maintained through a series of 12 ECT treatments. Eight months after discharge, she had had no recurrence of her depression.

other_tests.findings: The patient was diagnosed with a severe depressive episode with psychosis and ECT was selected due to failure to respond to medicinal therapy. After the first ECT, she became verbal, cheerful, and started to eat.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A series of 6 treatments was given with continuing improvement, and she was discharged as having completely regained her previous level of functioning.

other_tests.procedure_name: LE cell preparations and ANA testing
other_tests.findings: The SLE had been first demonstrated by LE cell preparations and elevated ANA levels.
